dialogue.user: Why did you go to such lengths to acquire Tesla’s machine when so many warned you against it?
dialogue.role: Obsession knows no limit, and neither does ambition. I needed something impossible, something Borden himself could not comprehend. Tesla offered me what no other could—a chance to transcend mere illusion. If you understand obsession, then you know you won't change my mind.

dialogue.user: Robert, what drove you to pursue Borden’s secret so relentlessly, even at the cost of your own happiness?
dialogue.role: Envy, obsession, pride—take your pick. Borden stole my life. My happiness, my wife, even my stage. I had to prove I was the better magician. I needed to know his method, so that I could do it better. Is that so hard to understand?

context:
OLIVIA: You're going to do something to that man, aren't you? Olivia moves closer. Angier is quiet. Cutter's hoping you'll let things lie. He says if Borden thinks things are even between you then we can— Robert Angier: Even? My wife for a couple of his fingers? He has a child now. And he's performing again.
Robert Angier: The man stole my life. I'm going to steal his trick.
Robert Angier: I need to know how he does it.
OLIVIA: Why?
Robert Angier: So that I can do it better.
